greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of f(x)^3 - 9 * x * f(x^9)^3 in powers of x where f() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
Cubic AGM theta functions: a(q) (see A004016), b(q) (A005928), c(q) (A005882).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of f(x^3) * a(-x) in powers of x where f() is a Ramanujan theta function and a() is a cubic AGM theta function.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (2304 t)) = -576 (t/i)^(3/2) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A133079.
mathematica: a[ n_] := With[ {m = Sqrt[8 n + 1]}, If[ IntegerQ@m, m (-1)^(n + Quotient[m, 6]), 0] If[ Divisible[ m, 3], 2, 1]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Jun 19 2015 *)
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ -x]^3 - 9 x QPochhammer[ -x^9]^3, {x, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Jun 19 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(-x + A)^3 - 9 * x * eta(-x^9 + A)^3, n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jan 19 2012
